content.description:
German poster of Kaiser Wilhelm I and Chancellor Otto von Bismarck, 1888

Private Collection/Bridgeman Images

Caption reads: “We Germans fear God and nobody else in this world.”
content.question: The prominence of Bismarck in the poster is best explained by his

choices.label: key role in establishing a new European diplomatic order after the breakdown of the Concert of Europe
prominence in advocating for a cultural campaign against Catholicism in Germany
reluctance to get Germany involved in the competition for overseas colonies with other European powers
dismissal from office by the new kaiser in a disagreement over Germany’s diplomatic policies

content.answer: key role in establishing a new European diplomatic order after the breakdown of the Concert of Europe

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
